text: Sonia Sanchez (born September 9, 1934) is an African-American poet. She is known for being part of the Black Arts Movement. Sanchez was born Wilsonia Benita Driver in Birmingham, Alabama on September 9, 1934. She studied at Hunter College, and New York University. She founded the Black Studies program at San Francisco State University. She was poet-in-residence at Temple University. She has written over twelve books of poetry.
